intro: Gilia leptalea subsp. capillaris, commonly known as the narrowleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. This species thrives in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
